ZDO_MgmtLeaveReq_t Struct Reference

This request is generated from a Local Device requesting that a Remote Device leave the network or to request that another device leave the network. The Mgmt_Leave_req is generated by a management application which directs the request to a Remote Device where the NLME-LEAVE.request is to be executed using the parameter supplied by Mgmt_Leave_req. #include <zdo.h>

Data Fields

ExtAddr_t deviceAddr
 IEEE address.
uint8_t rejoin: 1
uint8_t removeChildren: 1
uint8_t reserved: 6

Detailed Description

This request is generated from a Local Device requesting that a Remote Device leave the network or to request that another device leave the network. The Mgmt_Leave_req is generated by a management application which directs the request to a Remote Device where the NLME-LEAVE.request is to be executed using the parameter supplied by Mgmt_Leave_req.

Besides the deviceAddr field, the structure also has two more bit fields embraced into a single octet and taking 1 or 0 as a value:

  • removeChildren - should be 1 to force the children of the affected node to leave as well, otherwise, 0
  • rejoin - if it equals 1 the destination node will attempt ro rejoin the network after it leaves

Definition at line 744 of file zdo.h.

Field Documentation

ExtAddr_t ZDO_MgmtLeaveReq_t::deviceAddr

IEEE address.

Reserved; can not be changed by user.

Definition at line 746 of file zdo.h.

uint8_t ZDO_MgmtLeaveReq_t::rejoin

This field shall have a value of 1 if the device being asked to leave the network is also asked to remove all its child devices, if any. Otherwise, it has a value of 0.

This field shall have a value of 1 if the device being asked to leave from the current parent is requested to rejoin the network. Otherwise, it has a value of 0.
